source.text: Οὐδὲν ἄρα νῦν κατάκριμα τοῖς ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ.
source.transliteration: Ouden ara nyn katakrima tois en Christō Iēsou.

translations.KJV: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
translations.ESV: There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
translations.NIV: Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
translations.NLT: So now there is no condemnation for those who belong to Christ Jesus.

source.text: οὐδὲ ἐροῦσιν· ἰδοὺ ὧδε ἢ ἐκεῖ· ἰδοὺ γὰρ ἡ βασιλεία τοῦ θεοῦ ἐντὸς ὑμῶν ἐστιν.
source.transliteration: oude erousin: idou hōde ē ekei: idou gar hē basileia tou theou entos hymōn estin.

translations.KJV: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
translations.ESV: Nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘There!’ for behold, the kingdom of God is in the midst of you.
translations.NIV: Nor will people say, ‘Here it is,’ or ‘There it is,’ because the kingdom of God is in your midst.
translations.NLT: You won’t be able to say, ‘Here it is!’ or ‘It’s over there!’ For the Kingdom of God is already among you.

source.text: διδάσκειν δὲ γυναικὶ οὐκ ἐπιτρέπω οὐδὲ αὐθεντεῖν ἀνδρός, ἀλλ’ εἶναι ἐν ἡσυχίᾳ.
source.transliteration: didaskein de gynaiki ouk epitrepō oude authentein andros, all’ einai en hēsychia.

translations.KJV: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.
translations.ESV: I do not permit a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man; rather, she is to remain quiet.
translations.NIV: I do not permit a woman to teach or to assume authority over a man; she must be quiet.
translations.NLT: I do not let women teach men or have authority over them. Let them listen quietly.

translations.KJV: Thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
translations.ESV: Your desire shall be contrary to your husband, but he shall rule over you.
translations.NIV: Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.
translations.NLT: And you will desire to control your husband, but he will rule over you.

source.text: שְׁלַח לַחְמְךָ עַל־פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם כִּי בְרֹב הַיָּמִים תִּמְצָאֶנּוּ׃
source.transliteration: shelakh lakhmekha al-penei hamayim ki ve-rov hayamim timtzaennu.

translations.KJV: Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.
translations.ESV: Cast your bread upon the waters, for you will find it after many days.
translations.NIV: Ship your grain across the sea; after many days you may receive a return.
translations.NLT: Send your grain across the seas, and in time, profits will flow back to you.
